identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Media, Entertainment and Publishing

block.p: WPIX-TV, an outlet for Yankee games for the last 40 years, has reached an agreement with Madison Square Garden Network to televise 50 to 55 Yankee games a year for the next three seasons. No terms were disclosed in the joint announcement yesterday.

There will be 55 games on WPIX this season, starting with games against Kansas City on April 12 and 13. MSG, the cable network that in 1988 acquired the rights to televise 150 Yankee games a season through the year 2000, will televise the other 107 games.
The announcers for the WPIX games are not set. A station spokesman, Marty Appel, said Phil Rizzuto would be offered the chance to return.
